value.title: Download and Deploy a K12 Power BI Solution for schools
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick shares a Power BI solution he created for K12 schools in United States education. This solution includes instructions to create views for use with the Power BI reports. It also includes a Power BI Desktop template for pre-created reports based on your school data.  GitHub Repo
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/U1dC-iKgKys" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

images.title: Download and Deploy a K12 Power BI Solution for schools

value.title: Enable Power BI in Microsoft Teams for EVERYONE!
value.excerpt: Did you know you can enable the Power BI app, in Microsoft Teams, for everyone? Adam walks through how this can be done with just a few clicks.  App policy documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/MicrosoftTeams/teams-app-setup-policies  游닉 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership   *******************

value.title: Get more info with Power Query tracing in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: Tracing and diagnostics for Power Query can get you crucial information to troubleshoot problems in Power BI Desktop. Find out how!  *******************  Want to take your Power BI skills to the next level? We have training courses available to help you with your journey. value.title: How to use multiple url filters with Power BI reports
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick walks through how to use multiple URL filters with Power BI reports. This adds onto the previous videos we posted regarding how to filter reports using the URL.  URL Filtering Documentation - https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/powerbi-service-url-filters/  LET'S

value.title: Improve Power BI Report performance by using the filter pane
value.excerpt: If you are using slicers in your Power BI report, moving them off to the filter pane could improve performance. Patrick shows you what this could look like based on a real customer story.  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://twitter.com/awsaxton -- http://twitter.com/patrickdba

value.title: Incremental Refresh with Integers in Power BI
value.excerpt: How do you use integer date keys with Incremental Refresh in Power BI??? Patrick walks you through how to do it.  Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/admin/service-premium-incremental-refresh  Download Sample: https://guyinacu.be/increfreshsample  游닉 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership

value.title: Let's Talk Paginated Reports In Power BI (Premium)
value.excerpt: Join us live as we talk about where Paginated Reports in Power BI fit in. There is a place for paginated reports and you may not be aware of it!  游닉 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership   *******************  Want to take your Power BI skills to the next level? value.title: Mashup Engine Query Monitor for Power BI Refresh
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick introduces the Mashup Engine Query Monitor for Power BI Refresh. This is the MEQM! A report that can be useful to see SQL Server queries that Power BI issues during refresh.  MEQM Files - https://github.com/guyinacube/demo-files/tree/master/video%20demos/MEQM  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy

value.title: Microsoft R, Data Science and Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, we are joined by Buck Woody. Buck is a data scientist at Microsoft. We work together to show how you can easily visualize Microsoft R in Power BI. We use Microsoft R Open and then move onto Power BI Desktop.  The example used in Microsoft R Open is the Anscombe's quartet.   Download sample
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/yj3rZTwJZaA" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Migrate your Paginated reports to Power BI
value.excerpt: Are your paginated reports still on-premises with either Power BI Report Server or SQL Server Reporting Services? Want to move them to Power BI? Patrick shows you how you can do that using the RDLMigration tool!  Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/guidance/migrate-ssrs-reports-to-power-bi

value.title: New Contoso Sample app for Power BI Embedded
value.excerpt: There is a new Power BI Embedded sample application called Contoso Sales. The best part? The source code is available out on GitHub! Adam walks you through the sample application.  Contoso Sales Embedded Demo GitHub Repo https://github.com/microsoft/Power-BI-Embedded-Contoso-Sales-Demo  Contoso Sales

value.title: OData Differences within Power BI and how to refresh your data!
value.excerpt: Last week we looked at the O365 Bubble and how we use Authentication to go in and out.  This week we show it in action!  We will look at one of the limitations to the existing Power BI service and how we can actually use the new Power BI Preview service to refresh data from an OData feed using oAuth

value.title: OMG a CPU Spike on my Power BI Premium capacity! What now???

value.title: Power BI Embed Token Using Powershell
value.excerpt: In this video, Adam shows an easier approach to get a Power BI Embed Token using PowerShell. This removes the headache of writing code or having to worry about an authentication token.   Power BI Embedded Playground https://microsoft.github.io/PowerBI-JavaScript/demo/  Invoke-PowerBIRestMethod Documentation

value.title: Power BI For Report Consumers
value.excerpt: In this video, we look at Power BI for report consumers. Those folks that maybe don't author reports, but just view reports within Power BI. We introduce some basic Power BI concepts and introduce you to areas of the Power BI service to get you familiar with the portal.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/FMcnf5WU0x8" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Power BI parameters - Updating in the Power BI Service or with APIs
value.excerpt: In this video, Adam looks at how you can update Power BI parameters within the service or by using APIs. You can create Power BI Parameters within Power BI Desktop using Power Query. Then you can update those Power BI parameters once the report is published to the Power BI service.  PowerShell Samples:
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/MJVSu47iMmo" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Power BI Premium Query Profiling with DAX Studio and SQL Profiler
value.excerpt: Patrick looks at how you can use DAX Studio, or SQL Profiler, to do query profiling on Power BI Premium. This can help you debug query performance and more.  Guy in a Cube courses: https://guyinacu.be/courses  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://twitter.com/awsaxton

value.title: Power BI Premium: What is V-CORE pooling?!?
value.excerpt: Adam breaks down v-core pooling with Power BI Premium. Explaining where the v-cores come from and how creating a Power BI Premium node affects the v-core pool. value.title: Report level measures with Power BI live connections
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick looks at how you can create report level measures, within Power BI Desktop, against SQL Server Analysis Services Tabular live connections, or against a Power BI service dataset live connection. He also explains what is meant by report level measures. Bust out your DAX toolbelt

value.title: Row-Level Security in Power BI - Revisited
value.excerpt: We had some recent changes to Row-level security in Power BI. Row-level security (RLS) was moved to be configured in Power BI Desktop with the June 2016 release.  I walk through how you could can configure this now in Power BI Desktop. I also talk about some of the limitations.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in

images.title: Row-Level Security in Power BI - Revisited

value.title: Setting default values using COALESCE in DAX
value.excerpt: Learn how to get default values using the DAX COALESCE function instead of IF statements. A great way to avoid BLANK in Power BI!  Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/dax/coalesce-function-dax  SQLBI.com article:  https://sql.bi/659297   游닉 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership   *******************

value.title: Slicer Restatement in Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick looks at a small feature called slicer restatement in Power BI. This feature will help you to determine what was selected in a slicer. While this feature was added back in April 2018, we are betting that most folks don't know slicer restatement.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube --

value.title: Use a KPI in a table within Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, Adam shows you how you can import KPIs from Excel into Power BI. Once in Power BI, you can use the KPI in a table or matrix.  Import and display KPIs in Power BI https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/desktop-import-and-display-kpis  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com

value.title: Using DAX to format a list of values in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: Alberto Ferrari joins Patrick to walk through how you can use DAX to format a list of values within Power BI Desktop. This takes the concatenate values quick measure to the next level.  Original Quick Measure video - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SjSKCZtiNlI  Alberto's article - https://www.sqlbi.com/blog/alberto/2018/12/20/displaying-a-list-of-selected-months/

value.title: Using different languages with the Power BI site
value.excerpt: I look at how your browser languages affect what is displayed. This all comes down to your browsers and the language settings within. Different browsers are configured differently. Fiddler can show you what your language order is.  SUBSCRIBE! https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCFp1vaKzpfvoGai0vE5VJ0w?sub_confirmation=1
